intro: Capraria arabica, commonly known as the Arabian capraria, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native region. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Capraria arabica is often found in coastal and mountainous areas, where it thrives in well-drained environments.
